chapter.title: Structure of the RES index
chapter.para: The RES index is made up of a series of composite entities which are constructed using the data discovered by the crawler. Each of the composite entities has an owl:sameAs relationship with the various source entities used to construct it, a portion of whose data is cached in the index.

If you dereference the URI for the RES index (currently http://beta.acropolis.org.uk/, but this will change), the result is some metadata about the index, including information about how to perform different kinds of query, and some selected sample entities.

When a query is performed against the index (i.e., by adding some query parameters to the URI), the result is a small amount of metadata about the query and the results along with a list of these composite entities.

If you then dereference one of these entities—drilling down into it—the document returned will contain both the composite entity, and the cached data about the source entities. If the entity references, or is referenced by other entities, the relevant composite entities are also included.
chapter.tip: An index of the predicates which are used to generate the composite entities and cached alongside them can be found at the end of the book.
